1120432117438197769.text: We plan to 1) publish more about the system, to clarify this confusion; and 2) give users a way to interact with the system, even if Dharma the company were to cease to exist

1122979707874574336.text:
Mini-thread on http://DEX.AG 's new features (with demo gifs!):

1/ Instant buys! 

Click the "Buy Now" link on price quotes from @RadarRelay, @UniswapExchange, @KyberNetwork, and @Bancor to pop up a MetaMask window and execute your trade on the spot ("Sell Now," too)pic.twitter.com/TfNy5F8dV0

1120419244078968832.text: I use @Dharma_HQ. I enjoy the interest rate so far and I love what they do the same as you, and I'm glad they're experiencing crazy growth, but let's face it: it's a centralized solution. Yes, the protocol is open-sourced, but you don't use it: Dharma does.

1120419247828738049.text: To my knowledge, the only relay that utilized Dharma protocol is Bloqboard, and I don't see any loan offers there. Therefore, I assume that 99% of the volume on Dharma was created by a single entity: the Dharma company itself.

1120419251012231172.text: Hope that either things will improve or we will be more transparent about the degree of decentralization of Dharma or any other project.

1121438972364886016.text: Don't think DSR would help to restore the peg if it would be available now. There are plenty of ways now to lend DAI at 6-11% annually. Some of them lack scaling, but together they have pretty big capacity (about $10M lent and growing).

1120419249485492224.text: Kinda ironic, because Dharma was one of the companies that started the DeFi meme.

1120419245882527745.text: As a user, you interact with the smart contract of the lending product, not the protocol. You can't deposit or withdraw until Dharma will let you do so. The smart contract of the product is closed source and the deployed contract is not verified.

1121186761802158089.text: Put together some articles that I enjoyed reading on open finance.https://destiner.io/collections/defi-reading-list …

1121124904710103040.text: What is we could distribute developer funds made from issuance via DAO? Something like Decred's Politeia where one ETH = one vote. In theory, that sounds like an oligopoly, but in practice I think it would work (besides known problems like vote apathy and lack of communication)

1120750680904540166.text:
Just finished reading "0x Mesh Architecture" doc. Mesh will open bunch of new opportunities:
* low barriers to share liquidity
* permissionless listing
* be your own relayer
* messaging network for defi apps
